bibl.title: Ten Greek Papyri from Cairo Museum.
bibl.note: 1. P. Cair. Inv. 10709. A part of a private letter. Provenance unknown, 1st cent. A.D. - 2. Inv. 10499. A fragment of a deposit repayment. Arsinoite nome, 2nd cent. A.D. - 3. Inv. 10705. An official document. Provenance unknown, 3rd cent. A.D. - 4. Inv. 10643. A fragment of a receipt. Hermopolis, 4th cent. A.D. - 5. Inv. 10513. A petition to an exactor. Hermopolis, 4th cent. A.D. - 6. Inv. 10490. A fragment of a petition. Hermopolite nome, 4th cent. A.D. - 7. Inv. 10514. A part of an agreement of sale. Hermopolite nome, 4th cent. A.D. - 8. Inv. 10614. A part of a private letter. Hermopolis, 4th cent. A.D. - 9. Inv. 10454. A fragment of a private letter. Provenance unknown, 4th cent. A.D. - 10. Inv. 10746. Receipt. Hermopolis, 7th cent. A.D. - Pp. 41-42: A schedule of the exactores of the Hermopolite nome; - 50-52: List of the consuls called Caesar.
bibl.seg: ‘ABD-EL ‘AAL SALEM Noha, Ten Greek Papyri from Cairo Museum.

1. P. Cair. Inv. 10709. A part of a private letter. Provenance unknown, 1st cent. A.D. - 2. Inv. 10499. A fragment of a deposit repayment. Arsinoite nome, 2nd cent. A.D. - 3. Inv. 10705. A.D. - Pp. 41-42: A schedule of the exactores of the Hermopolite nome; - 50-52: List of the consuls called Caesar.
